hotspots.label: Spider's Eyes
hotspots.fact: Spiders have multiple eyes, usually 8, that help them see in different directions at once! These large eyes on top help the spider spot movement and hunt for food.

hotspots.label: Spider's Fangs
hotspots.fact: Those sharp, pointed parts are called fangs or chelicerae. Spiders use them to catch and hold their prey, similar to how we use our hands!

hotspots.label: Long Legs
hotspots.fact: Spiders have 8 legs covered in tiny hairs that are super sensitive! These hairs help spiders feel vibrations from prey and sense their surroundings.

hotspots.label: Spider's Body
hotspots.fact: A spider's body has two main parts: the head-chest area and the abdomen. The brown and tan colors help this spider blend in with bark and branches in nature!
